marklogic.body:
Do I care? Yes, I suppose. Am I going to do anything about it? No.
Apple shouldn't be marketing it as 4G over here that's true, but as already said, you do get faster 3G speeds (HSPA+) and the UK won't have a good 4G network for at least a year anyway.
I bought a new Ipad, with 4G, knowing it wouldn't work in the UK, and I don't really care now. It's not as if I'm going to return it. I can do anything I want on 3G and WiFi anyway.
Even if I did have 4G, my network would no doubt restrict it, thus limiting it's appeal. Apparently US users are 'Burning' through their data allowances.
